cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi ESE of Caibarién, Cuba and 275 mi SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest later Saturday, pass near the Florida Keys Sunday morning, then track north-northwest along the southwest Florida coast and inland up the peninsula toward Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys Sunday morning and the southwest Florida coast (near Naples/Fort Myers) Sunday afternoon

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Fernandina Beach and north & west of Anclote River to Indian Pass; Storm Surge Watch north of Anclote River to Suwannee River and north of Volusia/Brevard County Line to Flagler/Volusia County line
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from the Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the Florida peninsula to Anclote River including Tampa Bay; Storm Surge Warning Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the Florida peninsula to Anclote River including Tampa Bay and the Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially the southwest and west-central coast including Tampa Bay and Manatee County
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (57% cumulative) of hurricane-force gusts with tropical-storm-force winds almost certain (94%) Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft possible in Tampa Bay, including Manatee County Port; higher 5–8 ft further south toward Venice
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches with isolated 20 inches possible, leading to flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Embedded tornadoes and dangerous rip currents/surf may disrupt port operations
